sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.description: Control for embedding a Design Studio Analytic Grid in an S/4 HANA Fiori application
sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new AnalyticGrid. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getSelection selection} : object
    • {@link #getQueryName queryName} : string
    • {@link #getSystemAlias systemAlias} : string
    • {@link #getState state} : string
  • Events
    • {@link #event:stateChange stateChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.zen.dsh.AnalyticGrid.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.89.0 Please use the WD Grid control instead.
Control for embedding a Design Studio Analytic Grid in an S/4 HANA Fiori application

DeprecatedInfo.description: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

selection.description: A SelectionVariant specifying the initial selection state used by the AnalyticGrid. Depending on the specific query and selection variant state, this will result in setting one or more variables' values and setting one or more filters on the datasource.
selection.helpDescription: A SelectionVariant specifying the initial selection state used by the AnalyticGrid. Depending on the specific query and selection variant state, this will result in setting one or more variables' values and setting one or more filters on the datasource.

busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

width.helpDescription: Desired width of the AnalyticGrid control

queryName.description: Name of the Query to bind the AnalyticGrid to.
queryName.helpDescription: Name of the Query to bind the AnalyticGrid to.

state.description: A string representing the current state of the analytic grid, including data selection and navigation state. Intended to be used for saving and recreating inner application state in navigation scenarios, for example.
state.helpDescription: A string representing the current state of the analytic grid, including data selection and navigation state. Intended to be used for saving and recreating inner application state in navigation scenarios, for example.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

height.helpDescription: Desired width of the AnalyticGrid control

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

initialFocus.description: In the Dialog focus is set first on the beginButton and then on endButton, when available. If another control needs to get the focus, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the On-Screen keyboard on mobile device as, due to browser restriction, the On-Screen keyboard can't be opened with JavaScript code. The opening of On-Screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.
initialFocus.helpDescription: In the Dialog focus is set first on the beginButton and then on endButton, when available. If another control needs to get the focus, set the initialFocus with the control which should be focused on. Setting initialFocus to input controls doesn't open the On-Screen keyboard on mobile device as, due to browser restriction, the On-Screen keyboard can't be opened with JavaScript code. The opening of On-Screen keyboard must be triggered by real user action.

ariaDescribedBy.helpDescription: Association to controls/IDs which describe this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-describedby).

ariaLabelledBy.helpDescription: Association to controls/IDs which label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

fieldHelpDisplay.description: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.
fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

leftButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.
leftButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
LeftButton is shown at the left edge of the bar in iOS, and at the right side of the bar for the other platforms. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Left button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting leftButton will also set the beginButton internally.

DeprecatedInfo.description: LeftButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the beginButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

rightButton.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.
rightButton.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.15.1 RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.
RightButton is always shown at the right edge of the bar. Please set this to null if you want to remove the Right button from the bar. And the button is only removed from the bar, not destroyed. When showHeader is set to false, this property will be ignored. Setting rightButton will also set the endButton internally.

DeprecatedInfo.description: RightButton has been deprecated since 1.15.1. Please use the endButton instead which is more RTL friendly.

sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.description: The ValueHelpDialog control can be used to implement a value help for an input field.
sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new valuehelpdialog/ValueHelpDialog. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getBasicSearchText basicSearchText} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getSupportMultiselect supportMultiselect} : boolean (default: true)
    • {@link #getSupportRanges supportRanges} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSupportRangesOnly supportRangesOnly} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getKey key} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getKeys keys} : string[]
    • {@link #getDescriptionKey descriptionKey} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getMaxIncludeRanges maxIncludeRanges} : string (default: "-1")
    • {@link #getMaxExcludeRanges maxExcludeRanges} : string (default: "-1")
    • {@link #getDisplayFormat displayFormat} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getTokenDisplayBehaviour tokenDisplayBehaviour} : string (default: "")
    • {@link #getFilterMode filterMode} : boolean (default: false)
  • Aggregations
    • {@link #getFilterBar filterBar} : sap.ui.core.Control
  • Events
    • {@link #event:ok ok} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:cancel cancel} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:selectionChange selectionChange} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:tokenRemove tokenRemove} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
    • {@link #event:updateSelection updateSelection} : fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.m.Dialog#constructor sap.m.Dialog} can be used as well.
sap.zen.dsh.ValueHelpDialog.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.89.0 Please use the WD Grid control instead.
The ValueHelpDialog control can be used to implement a value help for an input field.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

_valueState.description: The hidden aggregation for the Dialog state.
_valueState.helpDescription: The hidden aggregation for the Dialog state.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

customHeader.description:
When it is set, the icon, title and showHeader properties are ignored. Only the customHeader is shown as the header of the Dialog.
Note: To improve accessibility, titles with heading level H1 should be used inside the custom header.
customHeader.helpDescription:
When it is set, the icon, title and showHeader properties are ignored. Only the customHeader is shown as the header of the Dialog.
Note: To improve accessibility, titles with heading level H1 should be used inside the custom header.

buttons.description: Buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog through this aggregation. When this aggregation is set, any change to the beginButton and endButton has no effect anymore. Buttons which are inside this aggregation are aligned at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer instead of in the middle of the footer. The buttons aggregation can not be used together with the footer aggregation.
buttons.helpDescription: Buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog through this aggregation. When this aggregation is set, any change to the beginButton and endButton has no effect anymore. Buttons which are inside this aggregation are aligned at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer instead of in the middle of the footer. The buttons aggregation can not be used together with the footer aggregation.

beginButton.description: The button which is rendered to the left side (right side in RTL mode) of the endButton in the footer area inside the Dialog. As of version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation buttons created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog. If the new buttons aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. With the Belize themes when running on a phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. While with the Quartz themes when running on a phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered on the right side of the footer area. When running on other platforms, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.
beginButton.helpDescription: The button which is rendered to the left side (right side in RTL mode) of the endButton in the footer area inside the Dialog. As of version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation buttons created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of the Dialog. If the new buttons aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. With the Belize themes when running on a phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. While with the Quartz themes when running on a phone, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered on the right side of the footer area. When running on other platforms, this button (and the endButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.

footer.description: The footer of this dialog. It is always located at the bottom of the dialog. The footer aggregation can not be used together with the buttons aggregation.
footer.helpDescription: The footer of this dialog. It is always located at the bottom of the dialog. The footer aggregation can not be used together with the buttons aggregation.

content.description:
The content inside the Dialog.
Note: When the content of the Dialog is comprised of controls that use position: absolute, such as SplitContainer, the Dialog has to have either stretch: true or contentHeight set.

The content inside the Dialog.
Note: When the content of the Dialog is comprised of controls that use position: absolute, such as SplitContainer, the Dialog has to have either stretch: true or contentHeight set.

subHeader.description: When a subHeader is assigned to the Dialog, it's rendered directly after the main header in the Dialog. The subHeader is out of the content area and won't be scrolled when the content size is bigger than the content area size.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

endButton.description: The button which is rendered to the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the beginButton in the footer area inside the Dialog. As of version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation buttons created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of Dialog. If the new buttons aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. With the Belize themes when running on a phone, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. While with the Quartz themes when running on a phone, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered on the right side of the footer area. When running on other platforms, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.
endButton.helpDescription: The button which is rendered to the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the beginButton in the footer area inside the Dialog. As of version 1.21.1, there's a new aggregation buttons created with which more than 2 buttons can be added to the footer area of Dialog. If the new buttons aggregation is set, any change made to this aggregation has no effect anymore. With the Belize themes when running on a phone, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the center of the footer area. While with the Quartz themes when running on a phone, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered on the right side of the footer area. When running on other platforms, this button (and the beginButton together when set) is (are) rendered at the right side (left side in RTL mode) of the footer area.

role.description: Specifies the ARIA role of the Dialog. If the state of the control is "Error" or "Warning" the role will be "AlertDialog" regardless of what is set.
role.helpDescription: Specifies the ARIA role of the Dialog. If the state of the control is "Error" or "Warning" the role will be "AlertDialog" regardless of what is set.

horizontalScrolling.description: Indicates if the user can scroll horizontally inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of the property.
horizontalScrolling.helpDescription: Indicates if the user can scroll horizontally inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of the property.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

escapeHandler.description:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function, you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behavior which will be executed when the Escape key is pressed. By default, when the Escape key is pressed, the Dialog is immediately closed.
escapeHandler.helpDescription:
This property expects a function with one parameter of type Promise. In the function, you should call either resolve() or reject() on the Promise object.
The function allows you to define custom behavior which will be executed when the Escape key is pressed. By default, when the Escape key is pressed, the Dialog is immediately closed.

keys.description: Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.
keys.helpDescription: Defines the list of additional keys of the column used for the internal key handling.

maxIncludeRanges.description: Defines the maximum number of include ranges.
maxIncludeRanges.helpDescription: Defines the maximum number of include ranges.

icon.description: Icon displayed in the Dialog header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it is density-aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.
icon.helpDescription: Icon displayed in the Dialog header. This icon is invisible on the iOS platform and it is density-aware. You can use the density convention (@2, @1.5, etc.) to provide higher resolution image for higher density screen.

title.description:
Title text appears in the Dialog header.
Note: The heading level of the Dialog is H1. Headings in the Dialog content should start with H2 heading level.
title.helpDescription:
Title text appears in the Dialog header.
Note: The heading level of the Dialog is H1. Headings in the Dialog content should start with H2 heading level.

type.description: The type of the Dialog. In some themes, the type Message will limit the Dialog width within 480px on tablet and desktop.
type.helpDescription: The type of the Dialog. In some themes, the type Message will limit the Dialog width within 480px on tablet and desktop.

supportMultiselect.description: Enables multi-selection in the table used.
supportMultiselect.helpDescription: Enables multi-selection in the table used.

maxExcludeRanges.description: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.
maxExcludeRanges.helpDescription: Defines the maximum number of exclude ranges.

tokenDisplayBehaviour.description: Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.
tokenDisplayBehaviour.helpDescription: Represents how the item token text should be displayed in ValueHelpDialog. Use one of the valid sap.ui.comp.smartfilterbar.DisplayBehaviour values.

stretch.description: Determines if the Dialog will be stretched to full screen on mobile. On desktop, the Dialog will be stretched to approximately 90% of the viewport. This property is only applicable to a Standard Dialog. Message-type Dialog ignores it.
stretch.helpDescription: Determines if the Dialog will be stretched to full screen on mobile. On desktop, the Dialog will be stretched to approximately 90% of the viewport. This property is only applicable to a Standard Dialog. Message-type Dialog ignores it.

filterMode.description: Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.
filterMode.helpDescription: Sets the dialog into a filter mode, which only shows ranges (conditions) and hides the tokens.

contentWidth.description: Preferred width of the content in the Dialog. This property affects the width of the Dialog on a phone in landscape mode, a tablet or a desktop, because the Dialog has a fixed width on a phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of the Dialog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of the Dialog width on tablet is 400px.
contentWidth.helpDescription: Preferred width of the content in the Dialog. This property affects the width of the Dialog on a phone in landscape mode, a tablet or a desktop, because the Dialog has a fixed width on a phone in portrait mode. If the preferred width is less than the minimum width of the Dialog or more than the available width of the screen, it will be overwritten by the min or max value. The current mininum value of the Dialog width on tablet is 400px.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

draggable.description: Indicates whether the Dialog is draggable. If this property is set to true, the Dialog will be draggable by its header. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be draggable only in desktop mode.
draggable.helpDescription: Indicates whether the Dialog is draggable. If this property is set to true, the Dialog will be draggable by its header. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be draggable only in desktop mode.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

state.description: Affects the icon and the title color. If a value other than None is set, a predefined icon will be added to the Dialog. Setting the icon property will overwrite the predefined icon.
state.helpDescription: Affects the icon and the title color. If a value other than None is set, a predefined icon will be added to the Dialog. Setting the icon property will overwrite the predefined icon.

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

key.description: Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.
key.helpDescription: Defines the key of the column used for the internal key handling. The value of the column is used for the token key and also to identify the row in the table.

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

stretchOnPhone.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.13.1 Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched Dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with Device.system.phone, then the Dialog is only stretched when it runs on a phone.
Determines whether the Dialog will be displayed on full screen on a phone.
stretchOnPhone.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.13.1 Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched Dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with Device.system.phone, then the Dialog is only stretched when it runs on a phone.
Determines whether the Dialog will be displayed on full screen on a phone.

DeprecatedInfo.description: Please use the new stretch property instead. This enables a stretched Dialog even on tablet and desktop. If you want to achieve the same effect as stretchOnPhone, please set the stretch with Device.system.phone, then the Dialog is only stretched when it runs on a phone.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

verticalScrolling.description: Indicates if the user can scroll vertically inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.
verticalScrolling.helpDescription: Indicates if the user can scroll vertically inside the Dialog when the content is bigger than the content area. The Dialog detects if there's sap.m.NavContainer, sap.m.Page, sap.m.ScrollContainer or sap.m.SplitContainer as a direct child added to the Dialog. If there is, the Dialog will turn off scrolling by setting this property to false, automatically ignoring the existing value of this property.

resizable.description: Indicates whether the Dialog is resizable. If this property is set to true, the Dialog will have a resize handler in its bottom right corner. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be resizable only in desktop mode.
resizable.helpDescription: Indicates whether the Dialog is resizable. If this property is set to true, the Dialog will have a resize handler in its bottom right corner. This property has a default value false. The Dialog can be resizable only in desktop mode.

showHeader.description: Determines whether the header is shown inside the Dialog. If this property is set to false, the text and icon properties are ignored. This property has a default value true.
showHeader.helpDescription: Determines whether the header is shown inside the Dialog. If this property is set to false, the text and icon properties are ignored. This property has a default value true.

supportRangesOnly.description: If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.
supportRangesOnly.helpDescription: If this property is set to true, the value help dialog only supports the ranges (conditions) feature.

descriptionKey.description: Defines the key of the column used for the token text.
descriptionKey.helpDescription: Defines the key of the column used for the token text.

titleAlignment.description: Specifies the Title alignment (theme specific). If set to TitleAlignment.Auto, the Title will be aligned as it is set in the theme (if not set, the default value is center); Other possible values are TitleAlignment.Start (left or right depending on LTR/RTL), and TitleAlignment.Center (centered)
titleAlignment.helpDescription: Specifies the Title alignment (theme specific). If set to TitleAlignment.Auto, the Title will be aligned as it is set in the theme (if not set, the default value is center); Other possible values are TitleAlignment.Start (left or right depending on LTR/RTL), and TitleAlignment.Center (centered)

basicSearchText.description: Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.
basicSearchText.helpDescription: Defines the value for the basic search field. The value is set into the basic search field of the filter bar used.

displayFormat.description: Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.
displayFormat.helpDescription: Represents the display format of the range values. With the displayFormat value UpperCase, the entered value of the range (condition) is converted to uppercase letters.

contentHeight.description: Preferred height of the content in the Dialog. If the preferred height is bigger than the available space on a screen, it will be overwritten by the maximum available height on a screen in order to make sure that the Dialog isn't cut off.
contentHeight.helpDescription: Preferred height of the content in the Dialog. If the preferred height is bigger than the available space on a screen, it will be overwritten by the maximum available height on a screen in order to make sure that the Dialog isn't cut off.

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

closeOnNavigation.description: Indicates whether the Dialog will be closed automatically when a routing navigation occurs.
closeOnNavigation.helpDescription: Indicates whether the Dialog will be closed automatically when a routing navigation occurs.

supportRanges.description: Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.
supportRanges.helpDescription: Enables the ranges (conditions) feature in the dialog.

cancel.name: cancel
cancel.description: This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.
cancel.helpDescription: This event is fired when the Cancel button is pressed.
cancel.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

beforeOpen.description: This event will be fired before the Dialog is opened.
beforeOpen.helpDescription: This event will be fired before the Dialog is opened.
beforeOpen.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

updateSelection.name: updateSelection

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.tokenKeys: type: string[], description: The array of existing token keys for which the selection in the table has to be updated.
eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.useDefault: type: boolean, description: Can be set to true to execute the default behavior of ValueHelpDialog.

updateSelection.description: This event is fired when the table gets an update and all existing tokens must be selected in the table. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
updateSelection.helpDescription: This event is fired when the table gets an update and all existing tokens must be selected in the table. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
updateSelection.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

beforeClose.name: beforeClose
beforeClose.description: This event will be fired before the Dialog is closed.
beforeClose.helpDescription: This event will be fired before the Dialog is closed.
beforeClose.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

afterOpen.name: afterOpen
afterOpen.description: This event will be fired after the Dialog is opened.
afterOpen.helpDescription: This event will be fired after the Dialog is opened.
afterOpen.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

selectionChange.name: selectionChange
selectionChange.description: This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
selectionChange.helpDescription: This event is fired when the user selects an item in the items table. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
selectionChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

tokenRemove.name: tokenRemove
tokenRemove.description: This event is fired when the user removes one or multiple existing token(s) from the dialog. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
tokenRemove.helpDescription: This event is fired when the user removes one or multiple existing token(s) from the dialog. Note: The event will only be raised when the dialog gets a table instance from outside via setTable.
tokenRemove.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

ok.name: ok
ok.description: This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.
ok.helpDescription: This event is fired when the OK button is pressed.
ok.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

afterClose.name: afterClose

afterClose.helpDescription: This event will be fired after the Dialog is closed.
afterClose.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

Model implementation for JSON format

fieldHelpDisplay.description: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.
fieldHelpDisplay.helpDescription: Reference to the element to show the field help for this control; if unset, field help is show on the control itself.

sap.zen.dsh.Dsh.description: Control for embedding a Design Studio application full-screen in an S/4 HANA Fiori application
sap.zen.dsh.Dsh.constructorDescription:
Constructor for a new Dsh. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

The supported settings are:

  • Properties
    • {@link #getDshAppName dshAppName} : string (default: "0ANALYSIS")
    • {@link #getRepoPath repoPath} : string
    • {@link #getWidth width} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getHeight height} : sap.ui.core.CSSSize
    • {@link #getDeployment deployment} : string (default: "bw")
    • {@link #getProtocol protocol} : string
    • {@link #getClient client} : string
    • {@link #getLanguage language} : string
    • {@link #getSemanticMappings semanticMappings} : object
    • {@link #getAppComponent appComponent} : object
    • {@link #getDeferCreation deferCreation} : boolean (default: false)
    • {@link #getSystemAlias systemAlias} : string
In addition, all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.core.Control#constructor sap.ui.core.Control} can be used as well.
sap.zen.dsh.Dsh.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.89.0 Please use the WD Grid control instead.
Control for embedding a Design Studio application full-screen in an S/4 HANA Fiori application

DeprecatedInfo.description: Please use the WD Grid control instead.

layoutData.description: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.
layoutData.helpDescription: Defines the layout constraints for this control when it is used inside a Layout. LayoutData classes are typed classes and must match the embedding Layout. See VariantLayoutData for aggregating multiple alternative LayoutData instances to a single Element.

tooltip.description: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.
tooltip.helpDescription: The tooltip that should be shown for this Element. In the most simple case, a tooltip is a string that will be rendered by the control and displayed by the browser when the mouse pointer hovers over the control's DOM. In this variant, tooltip behaves like a simple control property. Controls need to explicitly support this kind of tooltip as they have to render it, but most controls do. Exceptions will be documented for the corresponding controls (e.g. sap.ui.core.HTML does not support tooltips). Alternatively, tooltip can act like a 0..1 aggregation and can be set to a tooltip control (an instance of a subclass of sap.ui.core.TooltipBase). In that case, the framework will take care of rendering the tooltip control in a popup-like manner. Such a tooltip control can display arbitrary content, not only a string. UI5 currently does not provide a recommended implementation of TooltipBase as the use of content-rich tooltips is discouraged by the Fiori Design Guidelines. Existing subclasses of TooltipBase therefore have been deprecated. However, apps can still subclass from TooltipBase and create their own implementation when needed (potentially taking the deprecated implementations as a starting point). See the section {@link https://experience.sap.com/fiori-design-web/using-tooltips/ Using Tooltips} in the Fiori Design Guideline.

customData.description: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.
customData.helpDescription: Custom Data, a data structure like a map containing arbitrary key value pairs.

dependents.description: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.
dependents.helpDescription: Dependents are not rendered, but their databinding context and lifecycle are bound to the aggregating Element.

dragDropConfig.description: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.
dragDropConfig.helpDescription: Defines the drag-and-drop configuration. Note: This configuration might be ignored due to control {@link sap.ui.core.Element.extend metadata} restrictions.

models.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

visible.description: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.
visible.helpDescription: Whether the control should be visible on the screen. If set to false, a placeholder will be rendered to mark the location of the invisible control in the DOM of the current page. The placeholder will be hidden and have zero dimensions (display: none). Also see {@link module:sap/ui/core/InvisibleRenderer InvisibleRenderer}.

objectBindings.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

busyIndicatorSize.description: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.
busyIndicatorSize.helpDescription: The size of the BusyIndicator. For controls with a width smaller 3rem a sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Small should be used. If the size could vary in width and the width could get smaller than 3rem, the sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Auto option could be used. The default is set to sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Medium For a full screen BusyIndicator use sap.ui.core.BusyIndicatorSize.Large.

repoPath.description: Path to application specified by dshAppName
repoPath.helpDescription: Path to application specified by dshAppName

metadataContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected. The special setting is only for internal use.

blocked.description:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.
blocked.helpDescription:
Deprecated! Since 1.69 The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.
Whether the control is currently in blocked state.

DeprecatedInfo.description: The blocked property is deprecated. There is no accessibility support for this property. Blocked controls should not be used inside Controls, which rely on keyboard navigation, e.g. List controls.

busyIndicatorDelay.description: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.
busyIndicatorDelay.helpDescription: The delay in milliseconds, after which the busy indicator will show up for this control.

busy.description: Whether the control is currently in busy state.
busy.helpDescription: Whether the control is currently in busy state.

fieldGroupIds.description: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
fieldGroupIds.helpDescription: The IDs of a logical field group that this control belongs to. All fields in a logical field group should share the same fieldGroupId. Once a logical field group is left, the validateFieldGroup event is fired. For backward compatibility with older releases, field group IDs are syntactically not limited, but it is suggested to use only valid {@link sap.ui.core.ID}s. See {@link #attachValidateFieldGroup} or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.

dshAppName.description: Name of the Design Studio application to be opened.
dshAppName.helpDescription: Name of the Design Studio application to be opened.

width.description: Desired width of the Design Studio Control
width.helpDescription: Desired width of the Design Studio Control

id.description: Unique ID of this instance. If not given, a so called autoID will be generated by the framework. AutoIDs use a unique prefix that must not be used for Ids that the application (or other code) creates. It can be configured option 'autoIDPrefix', see {@link topic:91f2d03b6f4d1014b6dd926db0e91070 Configuration Options and URL Parameters}.

height.description: Desired height of the Design Studio Control
height.helpDescription: Desired height of the Design Studio Control

bindingContexts.description: A map of model instances to which the object should be attached. The models are keyed by their model name. For the default model, String(undefined) is expected.

formatError.name: formatError
formatError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated from the model, but formatting the value failed with an exception.
formatError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

parseError.name: parseError
parseError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but parsing the value failed with an exception.
parseError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationSuccess.name: validationSuccess
validationSuccess.description: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.helpDescription: Fired after a new value for a bound property has been propagated to the model. Only fired, when the binding uses a data type.
validationSuccess.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

eventParams.oControlEvent.getParameters.state: type: string, description: Serialized state string.

stateChange.name: stateChange
stateChange.description: Event is triggered when the state of the AnalyticGrid is changed.
stateChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

modelContextChange.name: modelContextChange
modelContextChange.description: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.helpDescription: Fired when models or contexts are changed on this object (either by calling setModel/setBindingContext or due to propagation)
modelContextChange.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validateFieldGroup.name: validateFieldGroup
validateFieldGroup.description: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.helpDescription: Event is fired if a logical field group defined by fieldGroupIds of a control was left or when the user explicitly pressed the key combination that triggers validation. By default, the RETURN key without any modifier keys triggers validation, see {@link #triggerValidateFieldGroup}. Listen to this event to validate data of the controls belonging to a field group. See {@link #setFieldGroupIds}, or consult the {@link topic:5b0775397e394b1fb973fa207554003e Field Group} documentation.
validateFieldGroup.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

validationError.name: validationError
validationError.description: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.helpDescription: Fired when a new value for a bound property should have been propagated to the model, but validating the value failed with an exception.
validationError.type: fnListenerFunction or [fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject] or [oData, fnListenerFunction, oListenerObject]

sap.zen.dsh.name: sap.zen.dsh
sap.zen.dsh.description: Design Studio Runtime Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.
sap.zen.dsh.helpDescription: Design Studio Runtime Library. Intended only to be used within S/4 HANA Fiori applications.
